name: Track Website Changes with Firecrawl, GPT-5-Mini, Notion, and Gmail

assignments.name: change_criteria
assignments.value: Either a visible text change or an image source update should be considered a change

parameters.subject: =Updates Detected on {{ $json.url.replace("https://", "").replace("http://", "") }}

parameters.content:
## How it works
This workflow monitors websites for changes automatically. It runs on a daily schedule to scrape target pages using Firecrawl, captures screenshots, and uses GPT-5-mini to compare new content against previous snapshots. Only meaningful changes (based on your criteria, like ignoring minor tweaks) are highlighted in summaries. Updates get saved to a Notion database for easy tracking, with optional email alerts via Gmail to notify you instantly.

The flow starts with a Schedule node, loops through your list of URLs, fetches and analyzes data, then stores or notifies as needed. It's scalable for multiple sites and keeps everything organized without manual checks.

## Setup steps
1. Import this template into n8n.
2. In the "Target URLs" node (or input section), add your websites as a JSON array.
3. Set up Firecrawl: Create an account at firecrawl.dev, get your API key, and add it as a credential in the Firecrawl nodes.
4. Set up OpenAI: Get an API key from platform.openai.com, add it to the GPT node.
5. For Notion storage: Ensure you have a database ready (duplicate the provided template), then add your Notion API key and database ID in the Notion nodes.
6. For email alerts (optional): In the Gmail node, set up OAuth2 credentials via Google, and enter your recipient email.
7. Define change criteria in the "Change Criteria" input, e.g., "focus on pricing or product updates".
8. Test the workflow end-to-end, then enable the schedule for daily runs.


**Need Help with This Template? Feel free to reach out. Our DMs are always open!**

**Email:** [hello@scoutnow.app](mailto:hello@scoutnow.app)
**X (Twitter):** [@ScoutNowApp](https://x.com/ScoutNowApp) 

No question is too small. We’re here to help!

## 1. Capture a Snapshot Using Firecrawl

Update the **Define** blocks below to set your target URLs and specify the type of update you want to perform.

The current target websites were intentionally chosen to demonstrate this workflow, as they change their content on every load.

## 2. Save the Snapshot to the Notion Database

Use the following page as your template: [Notion Page](https://scoutnow.notion.site/Track-Website-Changes-2b0c56764824800a993eca79f4b10bbf). It relies on two databases: one for storing snapshots and another for recording updates.

We split website content into multiple paragraph blocks because each block cannot exceed 2,000 characters.
## 3. Compare the Snapshot with the Last Snapshot If Available

## 4. Create an Update on Notion When Changes Are Detected

We use a custom Notion API to create column blocks and arrange screenshots side by side, 
since the official Notion Node does not support columns.

## 5. [Optional] Send an Email Alert

Send an email alert when new updates are detected. You can remove this section if you don’t need this functionality.
